subject: Medicine
title: The HIV/AIDS Crisis
description: A short lesson to help you apply The HIV/AIDS Crisis.

hook.text: In 1981, young healthy men started dying of rare infections. Nobody knew why. Panic spread faster than answers.

buildup.text: HIV destroys helper T cells, collapsing the immune system. AIDS is the final stage, where any infection can kill.

discovery.text: The virus jumped from chimpanzees to humans in Central Africa, likely decades before it was identified.

twist.text: Stigma and politics delayed the response. Governments ignored it because it first affected marginalized groups.

climax.text: Antiretroviral therapy now lets HIV-positive people live normal lifespansâ€”but 40 million have already died.

punchline.text: Stigma killed almost as many as the virus.

quiz.question: What delayed the global response to HIV/AIDS?
options: Stigma and politics because it first affected marginalized groups
The virus was too difficult for scientists to identify
Effective treatments were available but too expensive
